title: Parliament Police allegedly threatened
content: The IGP has been instructed to launch a probe into Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Harin Fernando bringing three torches into the Parliament Chamber on Thursday (24), and action against the incident would be announced after the report is received, Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena informed Parliament on Friday (25).He made this remark, when Leader of the House Dinesh Gunawardena and Chief Government Whip Johnston Fernando requested the Speaker to call a Party Leaders’ meeting over the incident.Gunawardena said Harin Fernando and SJB MP Manusha Nanayakkra threatened the Police personnel at the MPs’ entrance where they were told that MPs are not allowed to carry a pack inside the House. “The duo had threatened the policemen that they would be interdicted,” Gunawardena added. At this juncture, Chief Opposition Whip Lakshman Kiriella said similar incidents had occurred in the House during the past, and that they have become almost a  ‘Sri Lankan tradition’.“In one such incident, a wreath was placed in front of where the former Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was seated some years ago. I request you to think about it. However, we will accept the Speaker’s decision on this,” Kiriella said. The Chief Government Whip said they understand Kiriella’s concerns. “We have done similar things in the Chamber too. So we perfectly understand. But in this particular incident, these MPs had tried to smuggle a parcel into the Chamber and they had threatened the Policemen who tried to stop them,” he said.
